holidays.name: Data Privacy Day
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness about the importance of protecting personal data and maintaining online privacy in our digital age.
holidays.origin: Established in 2007 by the Council of Europe and supported by the US and Canada to promote privacy and data protection best practices.
holidays.funFact: Despite the serious theme, some companies celebrate by making humorous 'privacy policy' videos to engage users!

holidays.name: Fun at Work Day
holidays.description: Encourages people to bring more fun and laughter into their workplace to boost morale and productivity.
holidays.origin: An unofficial holiday created by career coaches and human resource enthusiasts who believe work should be enjoyable.
holidays.funFact: Some offices celebrate by wearing silly hats or hosting impromptu dance contests to shake off the midwinter blues.

holidays.name: National Kazoo Day
holidays.description: A quirky celebration of the humble kazoo, the buzzing, buzzing musical instrument that anyone can play.
holidays.origin: Started by kazoo enthusiasts and musical oddities fans to showcase fun, informal music.
holidays.funFact: During National Kazoo Day, some communities try to create the largest kazoo ensemble for a buzzing world record!

holidays.origin: Began in the early 2000s, championed by puzzle magazines and enthusiasts worldwide.
holidays.funFact: On this day, some puzzle clubs hold competitions to see who can complete the trickiest puzzle fastest.
